body: AFAIK Gitea's behavior is the same as Github's. The actions will always take the content (commands) from the main branch and execute them on behalf of your selected branch. It does not mean to use the chosen branch's commands but its environment.

IIRC, that's intended behavior for security reasons:
Otherwise, a malicious actor can simply log all secrets without you knowing, simply by changing an existing workflow on another branch, running the workflow, and deleting the branch again.
You don't want that to happen, so we cannot use your own changes to the workflow to execute the workflow.

GitHub only requires that the default branch defined workflow  with the same path has a on workflow_dispatch trigger as well to use the workflow of the desired branch. (while this bit me as well, it's not as restrictive Giteas behavior described by the OP, I have not yet used this feature myself )

(**this is a special case of manually triggered workflows on GitHub Actions**)

> Otherwise, a malicious actor can simply log all secrets without you knowing, simply by changing an existing workflow on another branch, running the workflow, and deleting the branch again.

You can do this already, just put `on: push` as a user with write access.

GitHub uses Deployment Environment Secrets for this kind of isolation (AFAIK, gitea does not implement them)

> It does not mean to use the chosen branch's commands but its environment.

GitHub Actions actually always uses the workflow of its environment, so this is Gitea specific.

The following is GitHub specific, some might align with Gitea
- workflow_dispatch (users with write access / uses branch selected)
- pull_request (users with and without write access, uses PR branch and workflow (incl. fork), conditionally no secrets)
- pull_request_target (users with and without write access, uses target branch and workflow, has always secrets)
- push uses pushed branch for both env and workflow

Are there gitea code examples to refresh a view from backend after changing a branch combobox?

The backend logic would be easy to change for me, but making a static ssr template change on form change not.

GitHub sends new html fragments when doing this

**EDIT Resolved, contribution guidelines / html docs**, e.g. `hx-get="/.../dispatchinputs"` and so on with target dispatch inputs html fragment

issue.title: workflow_dispatch inputs without a description end up without any label/name in the UI

repository.name: gitea
repository.description: Git with a cup of tea! Painless self-hosted all-in-one software development service, including Git hosting, code review, team collaboration, package registry and CI/CD

issue.body: ### Description Checkboxes and Comboboxes may not show any label if description is not set ```yaml on: workflow_dispatch: inputs: test-a: type: boolean test-b: type: choice options: - a - b - c - d test-c: description: One with description! type: boolean jobs: _: runs-on: windows-latest steps: - run: ${{ tojson(inputs) }} shell: cat {0} ``` ### Gitea Version 1.23-rc0 ### Can you reproduce the bug on the Gitea demo site? Yes ### Log Gist _No response_ ### Screenshots ### Git Version _No response_ ### Operating System linux ### How are you running Gitea? build myself / demo site ### Database SQLite

body: @ChristopherHX , thanks for a quick PR and fix.

> quick PR and fix

This could take until 1.24.0 for you to see this change.

main nightly (and gitea:nightly) has this change at the moment for testing purposes (_you cannot downgrade to stable without restoring a backup once upgraded_): https://dl.gitea.com/gitea/main-nightly/
